basics.name: Kylie Higashionna
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences and for a B.A. in Japanese in the Department of East Asian Languages and Literatures at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2024. I hope to one day work in Japan dealing in the field of artificial intelligence.

volunteer.summary: Helped the preschool teachers with many different tasks
highlights: Experienced working with preschoolers in the school enviornment

awards.title: E.E. Black Scholorship
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii at Manoa, College of Engineering
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i school.

awards.title: Placing 2nd in the Hawaii Annual Code Challenge
awards.summary: Placed 2nd overall out of 44 teams. Created a web application for HACC 2021's Hawai'i Marine Animal Response (HMAR), NIC Hawaii. This sighting and reporting app are to help streamline the process for the public to report monk seals, turtles, and seabirds, to be on a 24/7 web app instead of by call logs. Technologies used: Meteor, MongoDB, React, Semantic UI, Javascript, HTML/CSS.
